title: Ground History
description: Requirements for documenting and assessing ground history including previous land use, non-agricultural functions, animal presence, flooding events, and associated risk mitigation measures

requirements.text: Were growing area(s) used for growing food crops last season?
mandatoryStatements: Documentation exists showing previous use of growing areas
Information gathering for risk assessment purposes
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of growing area use history
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Document land use changes at beginning of each growing season

requirements.text: Has the growing area(s) been used for any non-agricultural functions? If No, go to 2.03.03.
mandatoryStatements: Records document any previous non-agricultural use of growing areas
Information gathering for risk assessment purposes
requirements.verificationExpectations: One-time or periodic verification of land use history
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Document land history before first agricultural use

requirements.text: If the growing area has been used previously for non-agricultural functions, have soil tests been conducted showing soil was negative or within an appropriate regulatory agency's approved limits for contaminants?
mandatoryStatements: Soil tests have been conducted by qualified laboratory
Tests cover relevant contaminants based on previous use (heavy metals, petroleum products, etc.)
Test results show soil is negative or within regulatory limits
Test results are documented and maintained
Testing is conducted before agricultural use begins
Appropriate regulatory standards are referenced
requirements.verificationExpectations: Review of soil test reports and results before growing begins
requirements.monitoringExpectations: One-time testing before agricultural use, re-testing if concerns arise

requirements.text: Has the growing area(s) been used for any purpose that included the presence of animals in the growing area (e.g., animal husbandry, grazing land for animals) in the last 12 months? If No, go to 2.03.04.
mandatoryStatements: Records document any animal presence in growing areas within past 12 months
Type of animal activity is documented
Information gathering for risk assessment purposes
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of land use history
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Document any animal presence before planting

requirements.text: If the land was used previously for any purpose that included the presence of animals in the growing area (e.g., animal husbandry or grazing land for animals), has a risk assessment been performed?
mandatoryStatements: Risk assessment is documented
Assessment considers type and duration of animal presence
Assessment considers pathogen risks (E. coli, Salmonella, etc.)
Assessment determines if waiting period or testing is needed
Assessment identifies control measures to mitigate risk
Risk assessment is reviewed before planting
requirements.verificationExpectations: Review of risk assessment before planting in previously animal-used areas
requirements.monitoringExpectations: One-time risk assessment, updated if new information emerges

requirements.text: Has flooding from uncontrolled causes occurred on the growing area(s) since the previous growth cycle? If No, go to 2.03.05.
mandatoryStatements: Flooding events are documented if they occurred
Extent and duration of flooding is recorded
Source of flood water is documented
Information gathering for risk assessment purposes
requirements.verificationExpectations: Document flooding events as they occur

requirements.text: If the growing area(s) and product was affected from the flood waters, is there documented evidence of a risk assessment, and that corrective measures were taken to affected land and product?
mandatoryStatements: Risk assessment was conducted after flooding event
Assessment evaluates contamination risk from flood waters
Assessment considers flood water source and duration of flooding
Corrective measures for affected land are documented
Product disposition decisions are documented
Waiting periods before replanting are established if needed
Assessment determines if soil testing is required
Control measures are implemented before resuming operations
requirements.verificationExpectations: Review of flood assessment and corrective actions before resuming production
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate assessment after flooding, ongoing monitoring of affected areas

requirements.text: If planting is to be done earlier than 60 days from a flooding event, have soil tests been conducted on the flooded area(s) showing the soil was negative or within an appropriate regulatory agency's approved limits for contaminants?
mandatoryStatements: If planting within 60 days of flooding, soil testing is mandatory
Soil tests are conducted by qualified laboratory
Tests include microbial pathogens (E. coli, Salmonella, etc.)
Tests include other relevant contaminants based on flood water source
Test results show soil is negative or within regulatory limits
Test results are documented before planting occurs
If test results are unsatisfactory, planting is delayed
requirements.verificationExpectations: Review of soil test reports before planting in flood-affected areas
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Testing conducted before planting if less than 60 days since flood

requirements.text: If septic or sewage systems adjacent to the growing area were affected by the flood waters, is there a documented inspection after flooding to ensure they are functioning properly and are not a source of contamination?
mandatoryStatements: Adjacent septic/sewage systems are identified
Post-flood inspection of septic/sewage systems is documented
Inspection verifies systems are functioning properly
Inspection confirms systems are not leaking or damaged
Repairs are completed before resuming operations if damage found
Verification that systems are not contaminating growing areas
Inspection is conducted by qualified personnel
requirements.verificationExpectations: Review of inspection documentation after flooding events
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Immediate inspection after flooding, follow-up to verify proper function

capaInject: If soil contamination found from non-agricultural use: do not plant until soil is remediated or replacement soil is used, conduct follow-up testing
If animal presence risk assessment not conducted: complete assessment before planting, implement identified controls
If flooding occurred and no risk assessment: immediately conduct assessment, do not harvest affected product until assessment complete
If planting within 60 days of flood without soil testing: immediate soil testing required, halt planting until results received
If septic/sewage system damaged by flood: immediate repair required, do not operate in affected areas until systems verified functional
traceabilityInject: Land use history must be traceable to specific time periods and activities
Soil test results must be traceable to specific sampling dates, locations, and laboratories
Flood risk assessments must be traceable to specific flooding events and affected areas
Septic/sewage system inspection records must be traceable to inspection dates and inspectors
